page.title: 01General Info;Dundrum
page.content: Physically this area is dominated by the North Inner Dundrum Bay. The land in the block slopes down to this stretch of mudflat from East and West. The Blackstaff and Ardilea rivers drain into the Bay. Cloughram Hill (89m) at 403378 is the highest point in the block. Dundrum Castle is also built on a prominent knoll. Dundrum is a small village which is mainly a dormitory town for Belfast and Downpatrick. It also has a service function for the surrounding countryside. Its tourist potential is considerably overshadowed by Newcastle to the South. Ballykinlar in the extreme South-East of the block is an RAF station associated with the Firing Range to the South. The line of the old Belfast railway line from 410373 to beyond 419390 has been managed as a Nature Reserve by the National Trust.
